lessonsLearned.lesson: PRD can contain duplicate/near-duplicate stories (US-001, US-002, US-003, US-004 all modified the same file). Always verify existing file state before implementing to avoid redundant work.

When creating multiple similar string constants (like prompts), the code simplifier will extract common patterns into helper functions to reduce redundancy. Design with this in mind - keep shared structure consistent across constants.

Decompose review prompts (FR-6) use different placeholders ({specContent}, {tasksJson}) and 2-way verdicts (PASS/FAIL) compared to spec review prompts (FR-7) which use ({specContent}, {codebaseContext}) and 3-way verdicts (PASS/FAIL/NEEDS_IMPROVEMENT). Separate helper functions were created to handle this distinction.

For TypeScript enum validation, use const arrays with 'as const' (e.g., const VALID_STATUSES = ['a', 'b'] as const) and .includes() checks rather than chained === comparisons. This pattern is cleaner and the code simplifier prefers it.
